metadata.title: CVE-2017-17479 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in thepgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes anout-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possiblyremote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2build0.18.04.1').
